landmark-one-main:
To ensure a document has a main landmark, you need to use the appropriate HTML5 semantic elements or ARIA roles to define the main content area of the document. This helps assistive technologies like screen readers to navigate and identify the primary content of the page. Here's an example: ```html Example Document with Main Landmark

Website Title

  • Home
  • About
  • Contact

Article Title

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Nullam tincidunt est ac dolor condimentum, vel vulputate nulla ullamcorper. Duis euismod mauris id neque tincidunt, sit amet commodo odio consequat.

Another Article Title

Phasellus at odio ipsum. Quisque posuere, enim at tincidunt aliquet, est sapien vulputate velit, eget iaculis lacus quam ac orci. Nulla facilisi. Proin bibendum est vitae sapien facilisis bibendum.

© 2021 Example Website. All rights reserved.

``` In this example, we've used the `
` element to define the main content area of the document. This creates a main landmark that can be recognized by assistive technologies. If you prefer to use ARIA roles, you can add the `role="main"` attribute to a `
` or other container element like this: ```html
``` Either
